constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: NHP Southbank And Waterloo Neighbours Forum (SOWN)
VISTA Westminster Pier To St Pauls Cathedral - 8A.1
SMNCI Site Of Metropolitan Nature Conservation Importance - Thames
LOLIST River Retaining Wall Festival Of Britain, Queen's Walk
CONARA CA38 : South Bank Conservation Area
OPPR London Plan Waterloo Opportunity Area

decision_conditions: No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to â€” a)	endanger persons using any highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military); b)	obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air; or c)	hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.
Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity of the site.
Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.
Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.

The advertisements hereby approved shall not be erected or maintained in any manner or use other than that approved by this consent. The advertisements shall be erected strictly in accordance with the approved plans. Reason: To ensure no adverse impact on amenity or safety and comply the requirements of Regulation 14 (4) of the Town & Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) Regulations 2007 (Policy Q17 of the Lambeth Local Plan 2020-2035 (2021)).
description: Fascia sign to front elevation including individual Letters to front elevation (atTicket Kiosk opposite the London Eye).
